{"step_by_step_thinking": "The most common cause of nosebleeds is trauma to the blood vessels in the front part of the nose, known as Little's area. This area is located in the anterior part of the nasal septum. A.V. aneurysm, postero superior part of nasal septum, and hiatus semilunaris are not common causes of nosebleeds.", "answer_choice": "A"}
